1.Customer Description: Independent, bold, trendy, middle-high class Male/Female, health-conscious
1.Where Do They Shop?: GT: Dukas, wholesale. MT: K/Acs, SMOs, superettes, Online
1.Purchase Pattern: Monthly and as & when to refill
1.Product Features and Benefits: Triple refined, quality, measuring cup, convenience, advanced spout, ease in usage and seal, safe + ringed, non-spillage, clear strip, fortified with Vitamin A&D, natural Vitamin E, cholesterol free, good for health

2.Brand Positioning: Alternative to Fresh Fri in affordability
2.Brand Extension: Small spout and Sustain the campaign on 'iflowkamaSalit/ #Sirindiohiyo
2.Customer Description: Women who want to manage & nurture their homes smartly & economically
2.Customer Pain Area: Customer want to be appreciated for cooking #Sirindiyohio
2.Where Do They Shop?: GT: Dukas, wholesale. MT: (K/Acs, SMOs, superette & Online)
2.Purchase Pattern: Monthly and as & when to refill

2.Competition: Golden Fry, Pika, Top Fry, Bahari, Ufuta

3.Variants: Aloe Vera, Citronella, Cool Mint, Pine Drops
3.Brand Positioning: Brand choice for ‘Affordable Family Protection’ from germs
3.Customer Description: Appeal to mothers who find Dettol aspirational and expensive
3.Customer Pain Area: Tough economic times, Consumers want value for money, ‘The Affordable option’

5.Variants: Blue, Cream, Green, Lemon, White, Yellow

6.Customer Description: Mass Mkt, average Kenyan Family fairly hardworking and optimistic, High consumption of mainstream media - CTV, Household run by the mother as the father works to make ends meet, There are economic strains which motivate children to work hard in school & parents to be lean on luxuries
6.Customer Pain Area: They need an affordable and natural product that works for the whole family & They also need an MJ that's easily available in areas they shop
6.Purchase Pattern: They regularly shop in neighborhood dukas - as the husband leaves cash enough for daily expenditure and food, SMOs and once in a while a tier 1 like Naivas
6.Product Features and Benefits: All natural. Soft and spreads easily. 90ml container is easy to scoop

7.Customer Description: Self Employed & salaried employees. Households with 2 streams of income, presence of children in most households who become the main consumers for the product
7.Customer Pain Area: They need an affordable, fragranced PJ good for the whole family. They are aspirational and would like to be seen as better or at par with peers - hence need for a premium looking but affordable product. Their current jelly is sticky and not easily absorbable
7.Purchase Pattern: They do their monthly shopping at Tier 2 & 1 supermarkets; they watch out for offers. On depletion of supplies they also shop at nearby shops. They are open to trying out products within their budget range and have used an array of products before
7.Product Features and Benefits: Sawa PJ is soft and smooth and not sticky. Premium looking design at an affordable price

8.Customer Description: Middle class & upper lower-Class Segments. Household still uses HW post covid to observe general family hygiene. No loyalty to a specific brand, but usage is maintained for products that deliver on moisturization, price and fragrance. They are open to try new brands that stand out on MT shelves or on offers
8.Customer Pain Area: They need an affordable handwash that delivers on price, quality and moisturization. They would also not mind an attractive pack that would enhance the wash basin area aesthetics
8.Purchase Pattern: They do a monthly or a bimonthly household shopping at the nearest T1 Supermarket, they look out for offers, sampling packs and new introductions within the various categories they shop in. Their recurrent purchase for a product is mostly pegged on price, quality and other factors as mentioned above
8.Product Features and Benefits: Sawa HW moisturizes hands. Product packaging is attractive. Affordable

9.Variants: Rose, Original, Herbal, Strawberry, Lemon & Honey, Chocolate, Bubblegum

10.Customer Description: Middle class Segments. Majority are current users of BW/ The usage for shower gels/BW is highly individualistic, with few instances of communal use within the family. Choice for BW is sensorial with scent being a key purchase driver
10.Customer Pain Area: Need for a bodywash that delivers beyond the normal soap attributes - sensual experience
10.Purchase Pattern: They do a monthly or a bimonthly household shopping at the nearest T1 Supermarket, BW purchased is expected to last them a month they look out for offers
10.Product Features and Benefits: Sawa BW is highly moisturizing leaving the skin feeling smooth and silky. Sawa BW has refreshing fragrances
10.Channel Distribution:
MT: 90%
Offers to be run seasonally – 30% off
Extra visibility to be acquired during promotions
GT: 10%: SMO

11.LSM (Socioeconomic Group): they shop mostly in GT – dukas and open-air markets

13.Brand Promise: Captivated by the essence of Africa
13.Brand Positioning: Afrisense brand positioning is about the connect with nature - trusting the provenance of African ingredients to nourish and enhance your skin. This is about a person who understands the _x000B_power of natural ingredients and is discerning on her choices
13.Customer Description: Employed or in business – leading relatively secure lifestyles discerning in their choices for personal care products. They are also aware of natural ingredients and strive to use these in their routine - this group is also interested in skin care and trends_x000B_2. Geisha Consumers - users of Geisha normal and special soaps but would easily try new quality products. Purchase decisions not led by price but quality and 'good' products
13.Customer Pain Area: Need for an effective soap at an affordable price. The soap should deliver beyond the basic cleansing attributes for any bathing soap
13.Product Features and Benefits:
Made from natural ingredients sourced from Africa
All ingredients are bio based
High in moisturization across all the variants
Leaves your skin feeling soft and smooth
Good lathering
